head.supplied: 21/12/83 ¶ ¶ It was a pleasing surprise to me, dear Mr French, to receive this morning the splendid pictural card with your and your young son's wishes for a happy festive time to me. ¶ I reciprocat...

div.p: RB MSS M107, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

It was a pleasing surprise to me, dear Mr French, to receive this morning the splendid pictural card with your and your young son's wishes for a happy festive time to me.
Card not found. The 'young son' would have been Charles H. French, who had recently commenced working in the Melbourne Herbarium. I reciprocate your kind wishes most sincerely, and as you both have doubtless a long life of happiness before you, I imagine, that you will celebrate Christmas and Newyear with your florishing family at very many and — I trust — always joyful anniversaries.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I am obliged to you for the packing of the zool. specimens. When ready Mr Luehmann will arrange for the Shipment by Clipper (White's) with an other box at my cottage. Adress Watson & Scull.
